name: Exposición Human Bodies. Anatomia de la vida.

reviews.text:
The audio was quite boring and models were very poor 
If you have visited any of the Dr  Gunther von Hagens exhibitions this is quite poor
Was To simple for the add You do I was expecting more I think you pay To much for what you get i would not recomended

Rather interesting exhibition with very basic information usually presented at anatomy lessons at school. Expected to see an exhibit item with the names of all muscles, unfortunately it wasn't there. Very little information of the nervous system. Also, extremely confusing diet recommendations based on the notion that muscles need sugar, therefore we should eat more sugar and cereal.

I went to see this exhibition on my own with an audioguide and I really liked it. They explain you the life circle from the beginning, I learnt a lot about my body and how I need to look after it. Very informative exhibition.

I am from the medical field and took this opportunity to show my husband some peculiarities about the human body. 
The explanations and level of conservation of the tissues and bodies were very good. Impressive! We loved it and would recommend it. Was worth 10 euros per person!

Hugely interesting, wasn't crowded at all so got to really see everything and take my time. I was there early afternoon on a Sunday. Fairly priced, and was given headphones for a guided tour. Well worth a visit!
Thoroughly enjoyed the exhibition. If you’re interested in Anatomy or atleast to know what goes inside our body - a must visit!
Very informative and well put together exhibition. The layout was easy to follow and the pieces were really cool!

This is a fascinating experience for over 12 year olds as younger children might lack the concentration needed as you follow the intimate journey of discovery of what (not who) we are and why we need to look after our bodies if we want a long healthy life. This is done in a tasteful, well organised way and at no point is it intrusive. 

Seeing the bodies of real people is a slightly strange feeling and it is important to establish whether in fact these bodies were given legally to science. 

The headphone explanation is well-done and accompanies you through the rooms, so much so that you are alone with yourself in many ways. It could be improved by have a 'fast' way through with a shorter explanation for those of us with little knowledge of anatomy. The exposition is in all languages including the language of Catalunya and its capital Barcelona, Catalan, which is a point in its favour and not always the case. 

The write to right, yes but also the write to right in Catalan brings me to my final point: Tripadvisor censored my first opinion and sent it back because it was in Catalan. It will not allow me to use Catalan when speaking about  this fascinating exposition. I hope Tripadvisor will realise the value of allowing travellers to use their own mother tongue, especially if one takes into account that hundreds of the hotels, restaurants and attractions adhered to the website are located in Barcelona and deserve to be commentated in Catalan, if the traveller so wishes.
I had such an amazing experience at this exhibition.  I highly recommend to everyone in the medical community.

The price is reasonable. It has so many languages to hear, although we hope they add Arabic,
The place is amazing and worth visiting.

Very interesting.
Not large as Milan exposition, but enough to understand the human body and the life's secret.

The displays start with conception, cover skeleton, muscles, nervous system, respiratory, digestive and more. The tickets price includes headphones with an audio guide (we had it in English) which was fantastic as you listen at your own pace. Visually fascinating. I’d only recommend for older children who already have an interest in the human body. Otherwise, due to the amount of facts in the audio it may bore them.
I visited the exhibition when I was traveling with my family. It was very interesting to see the human body and to listen about it.
no comprendo espagnol soy english. it was a fun experience. although i didn’t like the headphone guided tour.
It was very interesting! We had audio guide which was great because we could see and actually understand what we were seeing!

This exhibition is candy for anyone interested in understanding the human body from an anatomical point of view. Getting to see what our bodies look like from the inside is a wonderful opportunity, and the exhibition is prepared with great taste and sensitivity.

A highly recommendable activity.

Our bodies are amazing and feel even more so after being to Human Bodies exposition. 
Great experience!
Highly recommended for kids and adults.

Indeed, the items are a little dusty, but for someone who has never seen real plastinated bodies before, this is a must go.
I found it very educative, and the audio guide was very easy to follow,skip or repeat. 
The ticket was 10 euros in June 2019.

This is the third time I have seen the Bodies exhibition (previously in Dublin where I thought it was fantastic).
The exhibition in Barcelona is dated and the pieces are dated and covered in dust.
I do not recommend this exhibition as it requires the pieces to be updated and more interactive - it could be suitable for children studying biology.
